meanings.definition: To walk or march in a group.
meanings.sent1: The children trooped happily to the playground.
meanings.sent2: The students trooped into the classroom after the bell rang.
meanings.sent3: The ducks trooped in a line behind their mother.
meanings.sent4: The ants trooped in a long line, carrying food back to their nest.
meanings.sent5: The tourists trooped behind the guide, eager to see the famous landmarks.

meanings.definition: A group of soldiers or police officers.
meanings.sent1: The trooped gathered at the barracks before heading out on a mission.
meanings.sent2: The trooped marched in formation during the parade.
meanings.sent3: The trooped enjoyed a well-deserved break after a long day of training.
meanings.sent4: The trooped stood in perfect unity, ready to defend their country.
meanings.sent5: The trooped moved swiftly and silently through the forest, following their leader's commands.
